test2 0.1.0
  • Reference

MM

MM.Rd

Perform MM-estimation

MM(
  x,
  y = c(),
  N = Inf,
  setting = "exp",
  alpha = 0,
  epsilon = 0,
  penalty = FALSE,
  auto_gcm = TRUE,
  auto_bisection = FALSE,
  direct_c = TRUE
)

Arguments

x

observed biased data
y

observed unbiased data, can be NULL
N

population size, default to infinity
setting

assumed null distribution, default to exponential
alpha

penalty term for MM estimation
epsilon

assumed minimum observation probability
penalty

(ignore this)
auto_gcm

if TRUE, use the "gcmlcm" function from package "fdrtool" to perform fast GCM computation; else use R based functions
auto_bisection

if TRUE, use "optim" or "optimize" function to perform bisection algorithm, else use manually written functions
direct_c

if TRUE, directly use the C function "isomean" from package "fdrtools" instead of using "gcmlcm" function

Value

estimation result

Examples

MM(rexp(30),setting='exp',alpha=0.5,epsilon=0.2)

#> $v
#>  [1] 0.8234967 0.8234967 0.8234967 0.8234967 0.8234967 0.8234967 0.8234967
#>  [8] 0.9484070 0.9484070 0.9484070 0.9484070 0.9484070 0.9484070 0.9484070
#> [15] 0.9484070 0.9484070 0.9484070 0.9484070 0.9484070 1.0000000 1.0000000
#> [22] 1.0000000 1.0000000 1.0000000 1.0000000 1.0000000 1.0000000 1.0000000
#> [29] 1.0000000 1.0000000
#> 
#> $theta
#> [1] 0.9784646
#> 
#> $llf
#>     llf_all       llf_v   llf_theta       llf_k llf_penalty 
#>  0.05558616 -1.99502851 -0.06231251  2.23521249 -0.12228532 
#> 
#> $c
#> [1] 0.9122534
#> 
#> $loop
#> [1] 7
#> 
MM(rnorm(30),rnorm(10),setting='norm',alpha=0.5,epsilon=0.2)

#> $v
#>  [1] 0.3181488 0.3181488 0.3181488 0.3181488 0.3181488 0.3181488 1.0000000
#>  [8] 1.0000000 1.0000000 1.0000000 1.0000000 1.0000000 1.0000000 1.0000000
#> [15] 1.0000000 1.0000000 1.0000000 1.0000000 1.0000000 1.0000000 1.0000000
#> [22] 1.0000000 1.0000000 1.0000000 1.0000000 1.0000000 1.0000000 1.0000000
#> [29] 1.0000000 1.0000000
#> 
#> $theta
#> [1] -0.2813856  1.1107805
#> 
#> $llf
#>     llf_all       llf_v   llf_theta       llf_k llf_penalty 
#>   2.5271135  -6.8714173  -1.8585605  12.0317357  -0.7746444 
#> 
#> $c
#> [1] 0.6627874
#> 
#> $loop
#> [1] 6
#>
